public interface ReserveSet extends TransactionSet

  • Method Details

    • prepareForCommit

      ApprovalResult prepareForCommit()
      Saves the ReserveSet and submits it for approval after calling the pre-setup rules on it. If any of the line items of the reserves in the ReserveSet have amount equal to zero, then those line items will be removed and will not be saved. Also ensures that each Reserve in the ReserveSet has an associated ReserveLine. If no matching ReserveLine already exists then a new one is created.

    • newReserve

      Reserve newReserve(Exposure exposure, CostType costType, CostCategory costCategory)
      Creates a new Reserve with a status of draft, adds it to this ReserveSet and returns it. The ReserveLine of this new Reserve is specified by the provided Exposure, CostType and CostCategory. A NULL Exposure indicates that this is a claim-level Reserve. Also, the new Reserve will have its Transaction invalid input: '&' Reserving Currencies set to the same as Claim Currency. If this ClaimCenter installation is using MultiCurrency Reserving, then you should be calling newReserve(entity.Exposure, typekey.CostType, typekey.CostCategory, typekey.Currency) instead. The former recommendation (using this method to create a new Reserve and then explicitly setting a different ReservingCurrency on it) is still valid, but no longer recommended.
      Parameters:
      exposure - The Exposure of this new Reserve - can be NULL, in which case this will be a claim-level Transaction
      costType - The CostType of this new Reserve - cannot be NULL.
      costCategory - The CostCategory of this new Reserve - cannot be NULL.
      Returns:
      the new Reserve.

    • newReserve

      Reserve newReserve(Exposure exposure, CostType costType, CostCategory costCategory, Currency reservingCurrency)
      Creates a new Reserve with a status of draft, adds it to this ReserveSet and returns it. The ReserveLine of this new Reserve is specified by the provided Exposure, CostType, CostCategory and ReservingCurrency. A NULL Exposure indicates that this is a claim-level Reserve. Also, the Transaction Currency of the new Reserve will be set to the same as Reserving Currency (or Claim Currency, if Reserving Currency is null).
      Parameters:
      exposure - The Exposure of this new Reserve - can be NULL, in which case this will be a claim-level Transaction
      costType - The CostType of this new Reserve - cannot be NULL.
      costCategory - The CostCategory of this new Reserve - cannot be NULL.
      reservingCurrency - The Reserving Currency of this new Reserve - can be NULL (defaults to Claim Currency).
      Returns:
      the new Reserve.
